name: CommonHooks
description: Class for various common (i.e. client and server-side) hooks.

methods.name: handleBlockDrops
methods.description: Fires the BlockDropsEvent when block drops (items and experience) are determined. If the event is not cancelled, all drops will be added to the world, and then invalid reference BlockBehaviour#spawnAfterBreak will be called.

methods.name: fireBlockBreak
methods.description: Fires BlockEvent.BreakEvent , pre-emptively canceling the event based on the conditions that will cause the block to not be broken anyway. Note that undoing the pre-cancel will not permit breaking the block, since the vanilla conditions will always be checked.

methods.name: getVanillaFluidType
methods.description: Returns a vanilla fluid type for the given fluid.

methods.name: canCropGrow
methods.description: Checks if a crop can grow by firing CropGrowEvent.Pre .

methods.name: fireCriticalHit
methods.description: Fires the CriticalHitEvent and returns the resulting event.

methods.name: getAttributeModifiers
methods.description: Hook to fire ItemAttributeModifierEvent . Modders should use ItemStack.forEachModifier(EquipmentSlot, BiConsumer) instead.

methods.name: getProjectile
methods.description: Hook to fire LivingGetProjectileEvent . Returns the ammo to be used.

methods.name: getDefaultCreatorModId
methods.description: Used as the default implementation of IItemExtension.getCreatorModId(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack) . Call that method instead.

methods.name: modifyLoot
methods.description: All loot table drops should be passed to this function so that mod added effects (e.g. smelting enchantments) can be processed.

methods.name: modifyLoot
methods.description: Handles the modification of loot table drops via the registered Global Loot Modifiers, so that custom effects can be processed. All loot-table generated loot should be passed to this function.

methods.name: getAttributesView
methods.description: FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY, DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY

methods.name: modifyAttributes
methods.description: FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY, DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY

methods.name: prefixNamespace
methods.description: This method is used to prefix the path, where elements of the associated registry are stored, with their namespace, if it is not minecraft This rules conflicts with equal paths out. If for example the mod fancy_cheese adds a registry named cheeses , but the mod awesome_cheese also adds a registry called cheeses , they are going to have the same path cheeses , just with different namespaces. If additional_cheese wants to add additional cheese to awesome_cheese , but not fancy_cheese , it can not differentiate both. Both paths will look like data/additional_cheese/cheeses . The fix, which is applied here prefixes the path of the registry with the namespace, so fancy_cheese 's registry stores its elements in data/<namespace>/fancy_cheese/cheeses and awesome_cheese 's registry stores its elements in data/namespace/awesome_cheese/cheeses

methods.name: onLivingBreathe
methods.description: Handles living entities being underwater. This fires the LivingBreatheEvent and if the entity's air supply is less than or equal to zero also the LivingDrownEvent . Additionally, when the entity is underwater it will dismount if IEntityExtension.canBeRiddenUnderFluidType(FluidType, Entity) returns false.

methods.name: markComponentClassAsValid
methods.description: Marks a class as being safe to use as a data component . Keep in mind that data components are compared with Object.equals(Object) and hashed with Object.hashCode() . They must also be immutable. Only call this method if the default implementations of Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() are suitable for this class, and if instances of this class are immutable. Typically, this is only the case for singletons such as Block instances.

methods.name: validateComponent
methods.description: Checks that all data components override equals and hashCode.

methods.name: onChunkUnload
methods.description: The goal here is to fix the POI memory leak that happens due to SectionStorage.storage field never actually removing POIs long after they become irrelevant. We do it here in chunk unload event so that chunk that are fully unloaded now gets the POI removed from the POI cached storage map.

methods.name: canMobEffectBeApplied
methods.description: Checks if a mob effect can be applied to an entity by firing MobEffectEvent.Applicable .
